intro: Thesium angolense, commonly known as the Angolan thesium, is a flowering plant species belonging to the family Xanthorrhoeaceae. It is native to southern Africa, particularly found in Angola and Namibia. The plant is characterized by its erect, herbaceous stems and small, clustered flowers that are typically yellow or greenish in color. It thrives in arid or semi-arid environments, often growing in sandy or gravelly soils. Thesium angolense is known for its resilience to drought and is often used in traditional medicine in its native regions.
